settings.description: Who is giving you beauty inspiration these days?
I would definitely say Jasmine Tookes. She’s so elegant. She’s always giving effortless beauty.
Describe one of your earliest beauty memories

When I was in high school I never wore makeup at all. But I remember when I graduated, I was working with a magazine. I went to interview a renowned photographer friend of mine. And I remember him saying to me, ‘Chelsea, you need to put on makeup. You can't be walking around like this. You're beautiful, but you need to put on makeup.’ I remember going through my mom's makeup bag trying to figure out my foundation shade. But again, my mom's lighter than me. Once I moved to the States, I started going to the MAC beauty counter because they were the only ones that carried darker shades at the time. I remember going on YouTube and trying to follow tutorials as well.

settings.quotes: "...mixing and matching is key to my style and how I balance everything out..."

settings.description: Which SS23 shows have been your favorites so far?
Loewe this morning was great. Prada in Milan was also amazing.
Which shows are you most looking forward to?
I'm very excited for Miu Miu. That's one of my favorite brands.
Are there any beauty trends from this month that you’re excited about?

I’m personally excited about makeup-makeup looks. It’s been all about the natural and no-makeup makeup looks for so long, but I've been such a fan of colorful eyeshadows. Even now, I have a very dramatic eyeliner on. I’m also into simplicity. I think it's nice to have some good products that you love that you can easily put on. I hate when things are too complicated. I think it's very important that you can do your makeup in 10 minutes and you don't have to use an hour to get ready.

settings.quotes: “I get inspired by my own moods.”

settings.description: When it comes to fashion week style, how do you typically build your look? Beauty or clothes first?
Definitely the outfit. But makeup and hair are super important for me as well.
Your hair always looks so great. How do you typically care for it while you’re on the go during fashion month?

My secret is to not brush it or wash it too much. I wash it maybe once a week. When I wash it, I make sure to use a lot of moisture and oils so that it doesn’t get too dry or break off. But yeah, I think with my curls, less is more.
Where do you typically draw your style inspiration from?

I get inspired by my own moods. I also love finding inspiration in contrasts and in all the different and exciting ways people dress. Contrasts are so important to my style, merging masculine and feminine elements. For example, something super sexy with something super casual, or something fitted with something oversized. I think mixing and matching is key to my style and how I balance everything out. Also when it comes to color combinations and the fabrics. Even if I wear all black, it’s important for me to have some statement pieces on or mix and match different materials.

settings.title: Emili wears:
settings.text_center:
Satin & Shimmer Duet Eyeshadow in Satin Copper/Copper Shimmer
Lash Lift Serum Mascara
Skin Enhance Luminous Tinted Serum in 060
Softlight Luminous Hydrating Concealer in 060
Solar Infusion Cream Bronzer in Parrot Cay
Cream Blush Cheek & Lip Color in Camellia
Satin Lip Color Lipstick in Poetic

settings.quotes: “I’m personally excited about makeup-makeup looks. It’s been all about the natural and no makeup-makeup looks for so long, but I've been such a fan of colorful eyeshadows.”

settings.description: Given that fashion week is such a busy time, how do you practice self-care throughout the month?

I definitely get stressed. I couldn’t go from Milan to Paris because I ended up getting a fever. I was sick for 24 hours and I was just in bed. My body just couldn’t keep going anymore. But it’s really nice to have my boyfriend around. He goes to a lot of places with me and it’s a really nice thing. We try to make sure we have moments together outside of fashion week, like a great dinner or something. 

It’s always important for me at night to have a routine and wash my face. In the mornings before shows, I always start with my makeup and hair and literally get dressed 5 minutes before I have to leave. It’s always so busy!

Music is also really important to me throughout fashion week. The Madonna and Beyoncé “Break My Soul” remix has been on repeat at the moment. It’s a great track for getting in the right mood when getting myself ready to go out at night during fashion week. I love listening to Megan Thee Stallion in the car between shows. Mariah Carey is also a great mood booster on gray Paris days. I’m really into Janet at the moment, and “Together Again” is the perfect song for this season because we’re all finally back together at fashion week again.
